SCHOLAR.Definition: a learned person, someone who has studied a lot

PREDICT.Definition: say that an event will happen in the future

FOLLOW IN MALTHUS’S FOOTSTEPS.Definition: do the same thing as Malthus did

MASS.Definition: having an effect on a very large number of people

PROPHETIC.Definition: saying what will happen in the future

RESOURCES.Definition: the total natural available means for survival and development

SENSATIONALIST.Definition: presenting something only in order to draw public attention

PREDICTING.Definition: saying that something will happen in the future

GO BY.Definition: depend on, use as a guide

PATTERN.Definition: a particular way in which something is done

SANITATION.Definition: measures designed to protect public health

STABILISATION.Definition: the condition of something being less likely to change

LITERACY.Definition: the ability to read and write

CONTRACEPTION.Definition: the use of methods intended to prevent a woman becoming pregnant

IMMIGRATE.Definition: move to a country in order to live permanently there

EMIGRATE.Definition: leave a country in order to live permanently in another one

ACTIVIST.Definition: someone who takes action in order to achieve a social result

GOING ON STRIKE.Definition: refusing to do something you are supposed to do in order to achieve a goal

ENVIRONMENTAL FOOTPRINT.Definition: the effect a person has on the environment

CARBON FOOTPRINT.Definition: the amount of carbon dioxide released as a result of a person's activities

FOSSIL FUELS.Definition: fuels, such as oil that were formed underground million of years ago

CALORIC.Definition: relating to calories (units of energy provided by food)

ENCOURAGE.Definition: try to make someone do something by giving support and hope

GRANTS.Definition: sums of money given by the government for a particular purpose

INCENTIVES.Definition: things that make people do something

ENCOURAGING.Definition: trying to make someone do something by giving support and hope

INHERENT.Definition: existing as a natural part of something

DISCOURAGE.Definition: try to make someone not to do something

DEMOGRAPHIC.Definition: relating to the study of populations

CATASTROPHE.Definition: a great event that causes destruction

TICKING.Definition: a clicking sound made by a bomb before it explodes
